page.title: 12The Thynn Family
page.content: The present head of the Thynn family, which has owned the Longleat Estate for the past 405 years is Henry Thynn, the Marquis of Bath. He has had four children, three of whom survive today. They are Alexander, Viscount Weymouth, Lord Christopher Thynn and Lady Silvie. Viscount Weymouth who will inherit the Estate has two children, Lenka and Ceawlin who is named after the 3rd king of Wessex. The two children of Lord Weymouth have both attended the Horningsham School which is a part of the Estate. Lord Bath no longer lives at Longleat House but occupy Jobs Mill near Crockerton. Lord Weymouth's family, however live in a part of Longleat House.
